programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. programme.title: Charming the Hearts of Men
programme.desc: A sophisticated woman returns to her Southern home town and discovers her options are limited yet discrimination is plentiful. With the help of a Congressional ally, she inspires historic legislation that allows opportunities and protections never before afforded to women. Historical romance, starring Kelsey Grammer, Anna Friel and Sean Astin S E DeRose - Director Anna Friel - Grace Gordon Kelsey Grammer - Congressman Sean Astin - George Diane Ladd - Alice Paul Aml Ameen - Walter Starletta DuPois - Mattie Jill Marie Jones - Viola Tina Ivlev - Ruth Pauline Dyer - Jubilee.

programme.title: Burning an Illusion
programme.desc: A black woman living in West London hopes to marry her boyfriend, but finds her life thrown into upheaval when he loses his job and is subsequently arrested after getting into a fight. The experience makes her reassess her priorities, and she decides to reconnect with her African heritage. Drama, starring Cassie McFarlane and Victor Romero Evans Menelik Shabazz - Director.

programme.title: Every Breath You Take
programme.desc: A psychiatrist's career is thrown into disarray when one of his clients commits suicide. He then finds his family life disrupted after introducing her surviving brother to his wife and daughter. Thriller, starring Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan and Sam Claflin Vaughn Stein - Director Casey Affleck - Philip Michelle Monaghan - Grace Sam Claflin - James Veronica Ferres - Dr Vanessa Fanning India Eisley - Lucy.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.sub-title: Fantasy, Romance, Drama, Action, Mystery, Thriller, Horror, Documentary And Factual ║ 2009 ║ 12
programme.desc: Romantic horror fantasy, the third instalment of Stephenie Meyer's Twilight series, starring Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson. Against the background of a series of mysterious killings in Seattle, Bella is forced to make a decision about her love for vampire Edward Cullen and her friendship with werewolf Jacob Black Conor McPherson - Director.

programme.title: The Pope's Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist of the Vatican, investigates a rundown abbey in San Sebastian. The owner, Julia, claims her 12-year-old son Henry has been possessed by a demon. programme.title: Ride the Eagle

Her six-year-old son Terry has been placed in foster care in her absence, but when he has an accident, Inez spirits Terry out of the foster care system without permission and raises her boy under a different name. Crime drama, starring Teyana Taylor A V Rockwell - Director Teyana Taylor - Inez William Catlett - Lucky Josiah Cross - Terry Aven Courtney - Terry (Age 13) Aaron Kingsley Adetola - Terry (Age 6) Terri Abney - Kim Jones.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Dec 2023
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Cinema List: The Best Of Christmas
programme.desc: Fresh new look, redesigned programme hub, richer content….

programme.title: Dance First
programme.desc: In 1969 Stockholm, Samuel Beckett is due to receive the Nobel Prize for Literature at a ceremony attended by his wife Suzanne and dignitaries. As he ascends the stage to accept the honour, Beckett sparks a conversation with himself about events and people that have led him to this point. programme.title: The Three Musketeers: D'Artagnan
programme.desc: In 1627, gifted swordsman D'Artagnan heads to Paris with a letter of recommendation addressed to Captain De Treville, commander of the Musketeers. En route, D'Artagnan unknowingly interrupts a diabolical plot orchestrated by Milady. programme.title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
programme.desc: The Daughters of Atlas, aka Hespera, Kalypso and Anthea, arrive on Earth in search of stolen magic. The vengeful ancient gods threaten humanity, and the only brave souls standing in their destructive path are Shazam and his brightly costumed compatriots. programme.title: The Machine
programme.desc: Bert, a stand-up comedian known as 'The Machine', is targeted by the Russian mob when his hard-partying past catches up with him 20 years down the road. Bert and his father are kidnapped to atone for those he wronged, and together they must re-trace the steps of his younger self while attempting to find common ground in their often fraught relationship. programme.title: 12 Days of Christmas Eve
programme.desc: Successful businessman Brian Conway gets into a car accident on December 24, which turns into a life-changing event. Santa gives him 12 chances to re-do the day, and repair his relationships to find the true meaning of Christmas. Director Dustin Rikert's Groundhog Day-style comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, Spencer Grammer, Mitch Poulos and Uschi Umscheid Dustin Rikert - Director Kelsey Grammer - Brian Conway Spencer Grammer - Michelle Conway Mitch Poulos - Santa Uschi Umscheid - Harkin Mark Jacobson - Jet.

programme.title: Violent Night
programme.desc: Santa Claus materialises down the chimney of greedy matriarch Gertrude Lightstone just as criminal mastermind Mr Scrooge storms the mansion on Christmas Eve with an army of goons to steal 300million US dollars from the Lightstone family vault. programme.title: The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry
programme.desc: Devon-based pensioner Harold Fry receives a letter from his dying former work colleague, Queenie. She is living out her final few days in a Northumberland hospice. programme.desc: Teenager Miles Morales is reunited with Gwen Stacy and encounters a team of Spider-People charged with protecting the multiverse. programme.title: The Cinema List: Unmissable Sky Originals
programme.desc: Dive into a world of unmissable Sky Original films, from psychological thriller To Catch a Killer to the Oscar-nominated The Unites States vs Billie Holiday.

programme.title: The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry
programme.desc: Devon-based pensioner Harold Fry receives a letter from his dying former work colleague, Queenie. She is living out her final few days in a Northumberland hospice. Harold spontaneously embarks on a physically gruelling 500-mile trek north. Drama, starring Jim Broadbent and Penelope Wilton Hettie Macdonald - Director Jim Broadbent - Harold Fry Penelope Wilton - Maureen Fry Earl Cave - David Fry Linda Bassett - Queenie Monika Gossmann - Martina Claire Rushbrook - Farmer's wife.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: D'Artagnan

programme.title: The Machine
programme.desc: Bert, a stand-up comedian known as 'The Machine', is targeted by the Russian mob when his hard-partying past catches up with him 20 years down the road. Bert and his father are kidnapped to atone for those he wronged, and together they must re-trace the steps of his younger self while attempting to find common ground in their often fraught relationship. programme.desc: The Daughters of Atlas, aka Hespera, Kalypso and Anthea, arrive on Earth in search of stolen magic. programme.title: The Accidental Spy
programme.sub-title: Thriller, Drama, Action, Comedy, Crime/detective, Mystery ║ 2001 ║ 12
programme.desc: Martial arts thriller, starring Jackie Chan as a salesman at a exercise equipment store, who has dreams of living a more adventurous life. His wish starts to come true when he follows two suspicious-looking men into an alley and jumps into action when he realises they are robbing a jewellery shop. The resulting publicity from his heroic act brings him to the attention of a private investigator, who convinces him that he is the long-lost son of a rich Korean businessman. When he travels to Korea to meet this man he discovers he is a spy, and he soon becomes embroiled in attempts to prevent a new, highly-addictive drug falling into the hands of criminals Teddy Chen - Director Jackie Chan - Buck Yuen Eric Tsang - Many Liu Vivian Hsu - Yong Wu Hsing-kuo - Mr Zen Alfred Cheung - Cheung Kim Min-jeong - Carmen Wong Anthony Rene Jones - Philip Ashley.
